sections.title: Description
sections.raw_content: The sign function is used to determine whether a number is positive, zero or negative. It returns 1 if r > 0, 0 if r = 0, and -1 if r < 0. For example, sign (5) is 1 and sign (-23) is -1.
sections.text_content: The sign function is used to determine whether a number is positive, zero or negative. It returns 1 if r > 0, 0 if r = 0, and -1 if r < 0. For example, sign (5) is 1 and sign (-23) is -1.
sections.mdown_content: The **sign** function is used to determine whether a number is positive, zero or negative. It returns 1 if _r_ > 0, 0 if _r_ = 0, and -1 if _r_ < 0. For example, **sign** (5) is 1 and **sign** (-23) is -1.

sections.title: Example
code:
var x : real
        get x
        case sign ( x ) of
            label 1 : put "Positive"
            label 0 : put "Zero"
            label -1 : put "Negative"
        end case
